body: Well, copying recursively is a bad idea :) If you have time, make a pull request. I can't promise to merge it though. Depends on how much it would clutter non edge case scenario.

Pull request: done! Thanks for the quick reply, as usual. Yii2 is pretty cool, and I'm glad to help a little.

Oh, by the way, it was @rotnes who detected the bug.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

body:
Wouldn't it be good to also add a check to see if the assetPath is not a subdirectory if the webroot folder?
Since it never makes sense to publish already publicly available contents anyway?

if someone has the directory layout as it was the default in yii 1.1, e.g.

`@webroot = /var/www`
`@app = /var/www/protected`

and the app directory is protected by htaccess, it would still make sence. I'd not add such a restriction.
While recursive copying is definitely not valid, copying from web root is OK.

Well. Actually I can not see any problem here.
There are plenty of possibiities to create an infinite loop in application. No wonder XDebug has 'xdebug.max_nesting_level' parameter.
There could be a lot of possible developer mistakes, which can lead to such situation. We can not add an extra check for all of them.

I don't see a reason for any extra checks (which will impact performance more or less anyway) on this matter.

issue.title: Endless directory create loop after defining $sourcePath in AppAsset.php

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework
